intro: Copaifera trapezifolia var. tenella, commonly known as the Brazilian copaiba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest and is characterized by its lanceolate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is known for producing a resinous sap, which has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
